alert.note: Alert for Dimmit; Edwards; Frio; Kinney; Maverick; Real; Uvalde; Val Verde; Zavala (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 20 at 8:21PM CDT until March 21 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS WEST OF A LINE FROM ROCKSPRINGS TO PEARSALL MONDAY... .Strong winds behind a dry-line will spread east from West Texas into the parts of the Hill Country and Rio Grande Plains Monday afternoon. A cold front will arrive late Monday night and also bring near critical fire weather conditions that will continue into Tuesday. However, the strongest winds are expected in the daytime as strong winds aloft mix down to the surface. Expect winds of 20 to 30 mph with some gusts to 40 mph and afternoon humidity minimums between 10 and 20 percent. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 8 PM CDT MONDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR COUNTIES ALONG AND WEST OF A LINE FROM ROCKSPRINGS TO PEARSALL... The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio has issued a Red Flag Warning for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 1 PM to 8 PM CDT Monday. * WINDS...Southwest to west 15 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...10 to 20 percent. * IMPACTS...Any wildfires ignited may spread rapidly and unpredictably. Prevention of fire starts by avoiding planned burning, or by limiting activities prone to produce sparks can stop the start and spread of wildfires.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Dimmit; Edwards; Frio; Kinney; Maverick; Real; Uvalde; Val Verde; Zavala
